dcterms:creator: D. A. Kessler

dcterms:description: This dataset provides insights into the effective potential for cellular size control, particularly in E. coli, and is used to illustrate the adder mechanism in cell division.
dcterms:title: E. coli division

dcterms:description: This dataset examines how size control in mammalian cells involves modulation of both growth rate and cell cycle duration.
dcterms:title: Size control in mammalian cells

dcterms:creator: D. Chandler-Brown
K. M. Schmoller

dcterms:description: This dataset explores the adder phenomenon, which emerges from the independent control of pre- and post-start phases of the budding yeast cell cycle.
dcterms:title: The Adder Phenomenon

M. Hoffmann

dcterms:description: This dataset involves statistical estimation of a growth-fragmentation model observed on a genealogical tree, providing insights into stochastic mapping methods.
dcterms:title: Stochastic mapping methods

dcterms:description: This dataset discusses the mechanistic origin of cell-size control and homeostasis in bacteria, focusing on the initiation-adder mechanism.
dcterms:title: Initiation-adder mechanism

dcterms:description: This dataset provides insights into cell-size control and homeostasis in bacteria, exploring the mechanisms that regulate cell size.
dcterms:title: Cell-size control and homeostasis in bacteria
